FuncDef:
The l2 command configures a load balancing mode for Layer 2 packets.
The undo l2 command deletes the specified load balancing mode of Layer 2 packets or restores the default load balancing mode of Layer 2 packets. The l2 command configures a load balancing mode for Layer 2 packets. The undo l2 command deletes the specified load balancing mode of Layer 2 packets or restores the default load balancing mode of Layer 2 packets. By default, Layer 2 packets on internal communication interfaces are load balanced based on sbsp, dst-mac, and src-mac. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6881H and CE6881H-K.
CLIs: l2 { sbsp | dst-mac | src-mac | eth-type | outer-vlan | inner-vlan }
undo l2 [ sbsp | dst-mac | src-mac | eth-type | outer-vlan | inner-vlan ]
